message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM

The paper introduces a new data augmentation method for training CNNs, which is primarily used in computer vision tasks such as image classification, object detection, and person re-identification. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also discusses the benefits of the proposed method in reducing over-fitting and making the model robust to occlusion, which suggests that it could be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper mentions that Random Erasing can be integrated with most CNN-based recognition models, indicating that it could be applicable to sub-categories such as cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.MM (Multimedia).
